result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary S Williams Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns, or class B establishments unless for employment purposes.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Must do at least 16 hours each month for six months.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gary S Williams in court with attorney Anne M. Katte.  Defendant Gary S Williams in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:18 PM. Court has plea qusetionnaire, looks as if the defendant will be pleading NC to counts #2 and #3 as alleged. Williams and Katte agree. State - count #1 will be DRICourt goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. Court dismisses and reads in count #1. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation of on both counts #2 and #3 - place on probation for 3 years, #2 - impose and stay a 9 month jail term, count #3 - impose and stay a 9 month jail term - consecutive to count #2, court costs on each count, other conditions are free to argue but has some suggestions of: AODA and follow thru, cost of $200 from Forest County Drug Task Force - to be paid within first 6 months of probation, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns, bars or similar establishments unless for work related issues, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 100 hours of community service. Katte makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Katte has no objections to recommendation and conditions as recited by State. Williams withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #2 and #3 - place on probation for 3 years - concurrent to each other, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, $200.00 cost to Forest County Drug Task Force - take bond posted, $10.00 fine plus costs - take bond posted - remainder due thry probation, #3 - $10.00 fine plus cost, at least 16 hours of community service each month for 6 months, no possession of alcohol, no entry into any class B establishments unless for work related, submit DNA sample, no credit granted, counts #2 and #3 - impose and stay 9 months jail on each count - consecutive to each other - huber allowed, right to appeal, adjourned at 3:33 PM.
Final pre-trial on August 30, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Gary S Williams in court with attorney Anne M. Katte.  Defendant Gary S Williams in custody.  Tara Maureen Guelzow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:07 AM. Court has received waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed an Information that mirros the complaint, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts and would like to address bond and the defendant's custody issue. Court accepts plea and allows argument for bond. Katte makes argument for bond - asks for signature bond, states that the defendant's current sentence that he is serving will be completed tomorrow, 3/30/16 and the fact that he may have to sit on a committment order. Clerk informs parties that she has reinstated the payment plan so there is no longer a committment order in effect. State makes argument for bond reduction - asks bond to remain as is at $500.00 cash. Court - bond - continues bond as is. Court sets for FPT. State will send discovery.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 30, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gary S Williams, in custody, in court with attorney Anne M. Katte appearing via video.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Habeck appears via video. Called 3:54 PM. Katte indicates conference was set for either a time waiver or PH waiver because she was able to speak briefly with the defendant before todays proceedings. Judge explains proceedure for PH. Williams would like to have a PH. Judge indicates time limits would need to waived. Williams will waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gary S Williams in court with attorney Chad Lynch who appears specially today.  Defendant Gary S Williams in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:15 AM. Lynch has not gone over the complaint, the defendant does qualify for SPD and believes Attorney Katte will be representing the defendant. Lynch requesting another adjournment at this point. Court continues bond and sets for PH. Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gary S Williams in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:38 AM. Williams has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Williams understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, financial conditions have not changed. Court instructs to contact SPD to get Mr. Richards assigned to this matter as well. Court sets for AIA, warns of returning without an attorney at next appearance. State - bond - $1000.00 cash for stated reasons. Court - $1000.00 cash, no consumption of alcohol. Williams asks for $500.00 cash. State - bond - needs confirmation of address. Court - $500.00 cash with same conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.
